intro: Descurainia canescens var. purpureola, commonly known as the purpleleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its gray-green, fuzzy leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and along roadsides. The variety purpureola is distinguished by its reddish-purple stems and leaves, giving it a striking appearance in its native habitat.
